name: chicagotribune
text: With “no perfect solution” in sight, schools in Arlington Heights and Plainfield became the latest Chicagoland districts to move to remote learning only this fall https://t.co/0kwKcAjC9c

name: chicagotribune
text:
In New York, 131 transit workers have died from the coronavirus and over 4,000 have tested positive. Now, workers are facing the prospect of a second wave — even as they are coping with trauma from the first outbreak.

From The New York Times: https://t.co/t5UrqNSYLq

name: chicagotribune
text: Kanye West’s bid to make the Nov. 3 Illinois ballot as an independent presidential contender and Willie Wilson’s effort to run as a third-party U.S. Senate candidate are facing candidacy petition challenges, State Board of Elections records show https://t.co/gcLEQPQsQ0

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago is threatening fines for people who don’t self-quarantine upon return from Wisconsin. But up north, concerns are few: "I don’t think people are going to listen to it." https://t.co/foXl4wtPTN

name: chicagotribune
text: At least three Chicago high schools have voted to discontinue having resource officers from the Chicago Police Department — but at least 15 more have decided to keep their officers, and dozens of others have yet to decide https://t.co/D2FIDejuFg

name: chicagotribune
text: During a campaign event, Joe Biden held notes that were captured by an Associated Press photographer. Scrawled across the top was California Sen. Kamala Harris' name, followed by five talking points. Among them: “Do not hold grudges.” https://t.co/j5ejAmszTd

name: chicagotribune
text: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden promised Tuesday that his economic agenda would combat long-standing racial inequalities https://t.co/JcKo7C66f0

name: chicagotribune
text: Bottled Blonde, the River North bar better known for its legal drama than its pizza, closed permanently on Monday due to the coronavirus https://t.co/l64D0TL75W

name: chicagotribune
text: The “Umbrella Man” seen on video smashing windows of a Minneapolis store during George Floyd protests was a white supremacist trying to incite rioting, police say https://t.co/OZJRXO10Gi
